channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Assad regime's fall has freed displaced Syrians stuck in a remote desert camp

item.title: Biden signs a bill officially making the bald eagle the national bird of the US

item.description: American Airlines passengers across the U.S. endured a sudden disruption of service on Christmas Eve as a "technical issue" forced the airline to requ...

item.title: Ukraine's war stamps put humour, patriotism and swearing in the post
item.description: Ukraine's war stamps, some with swear words, boost morale at home and promote its image abroad.

item.title: 25 survive plane crash in Kazakhstan that killed dozens, officials say
item.description: 25 people survived a plane crash in Kazakhstan that killed dozens, officials said, adding that three of the survivors weren't even hospitalized.

item.title: 12/24: CBS Evening News
item.description: Who will see snow on Christmas day?; Mall Santas provide special service for kids with sensory issues

item.title: Three shot dead as medics, journalists and police attacked at Haiti hospital
item.description: Two journalists and a police officer are reported to have been killed, with others injured in the attack.

item.title: Starbucks baristas' 'strike before Christmas' has reached hundreds of U.S. stores

item.title: Palestinian Christians struggle to find hope at Christmas
item.description: For the second year running, tourists are staying away and public festivities have been cancelled.

item.title: Man arraigned on murder charges in NYC subway death fanned flames with a shirt, prosecutors say
Greenland and the Panama Canal aren't for sale. Why is Trump threatening to take them?
item.description: Trump's promises to use America's strength to its advantage helped propel him twice to the White House.

item.title: Dozens killed as passenger plane crashes in Kazakhstan
item.description: There were 67 people on board when the plane crashed near the city of Aktau.
